articles.title: Kim Jong Un Inspects Company of KPA Unit
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Inspects Company of KPA Unit
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and  first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, inspected the Thrice Three-Revolution Red Flag Kamnamu Company (a company under persimmon trees) under KPA Unit 4302.
					 He was greeted by commanding officers of the unit and the company.
					
					 He presented a pair of binoculars and an automatic rifle to the company and had a photo taken with its soldiers, expressing his expectation and belief that they would defend the socialist country as firm as an iron wall.
					
					 Conducted by the commanding officers, Kim Jong Un looked round the monument to the field guidance of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Then he went round an education room, soldiers' bed rooms and mess hall.
					
					 The mere name of the company touches everybody, Kim Jong Un said, adding the company has been recorded in the history of the Songun revolutionary leadership as the one which shows Kim Jong Il's love for soldiers and is well-known at home and abroad for it.
					
					 Kim Jong Un said there are in the company at present not many soldiers who were received by Kim Jong Il, underscoring the need to invariably carry forward the spirit and tradition of the company and glorify the immortal exploits of Kim Jong Il recorded in the history of the company though an old generation is replaced by a new one.
					
					 Kim Jong Un was satisfied to learn that the company has preserved the desks in the education room as they were since the field guidance of Kim Il Sung several decades ago.
					
					 He dropped in at the bedroom visited by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and saw the places where they were seated and even touched a blanket to guess its quality.
					
					 At the wash-cum-bath room, Kim Jong Un was briefed on the steam bath using hemp.
					
					 At the mess hall, he saw a list of daily food supply norm, asking if the company supplies food to the soldiers according to it and if there is anything insufficient. He called for supplying food to them as prescribed.
					
					 Seeing crabs among varieties of food under preparation at the kitchen, Kim Jong Un asked where they were caught, how they were cooked and what soldiers liked best. 
					
					 Kim Jong Un visited a salt farm operated by the company itself.  
					
					 He looked round the fire position of the company to acquaint himself with the performance of its combat duty.
					
					 He watched the fire position, combat and technical equipment and defence fortification associated with the footprints of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, giving precious instructions.
					
					 He warmly encouraged the company's service personnel, telling them that they should join hands with their supreme commander, reunify the country without fail and eternally glorify the exploits performed by the generalissimos. He added he believed in the service personnel on the eastern front and reposed deep trust in the women revolutionaries defending a post on the front.
					
					 He walked the road leading to the post and asked how many persimmons the company gathered last year. Saying persimmons still look unripe, he said he would come again in a season when persimmons get ripe.
					
					 He spared time to watch a performance given by the company's art group.
					
					 Put on the stage were such colorful numbers as chorus "March of the Korean Youth", narration and song "General and Our Kamnamu  Company", solo and pangchang "Boundless Is Our Yearning", sextet "Our Leader Loved by People" and group poem recital and chorus "Let's Protect General Kim Jong Un with Our Lives".
					
					 He gave his big hands to congratulate them on their successful performance.
					
					 Kim Jong Un had a talk with the company's soldiers.
					
					 He told them to set an example to be followed by the whole army by successfully making preparations for combat and conducting good art group activities. He called on them to keep themselves highly alerted in view of enemies' reckless maneuvers for a war of aggression and watch with high vigilance the enemies' moves. He ordered them to send the enemies to the bottom of the sea even if one of them intrudes into the territorial waters of the DPRK.
					
					 Reading the minds of the soldiers reluctant to part from him, he told them to stand by him one by one and had a photo taken with them.
					
					 At the end of the photo session, he promised them to visit the company again and have a photo taken with its commander and political commissar who were absent in the photo session.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Chairman of Italian General Investment Group
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Chairman of Italian General Investment Group
						
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with Giancarlo Elia Valori, chairman of the Italian General Investment Group, who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam to Visit Iran
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam to Visit Iran 
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, will take part in the 16th Non-aligned Summit due in Tehran briefly and pay an official goodwill visit to Iran at the invitation of Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Inspects Flood-hit Hyangsan and Kujang Counties
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Inspects Flood-hit Hyangsan and Kujang Counties
						
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- Premier of the Cabinet Choe Yong Rim, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, inspected Hyangsan and Kujang Counties in North Phyongan Province to learn about the flood damage and the operations to recover from the damage. 
					 The heavy rains hit the counties, breaking dykes of reservoirs and rivers, leaving hundreds of dwelling houses, public buildings, bridges, tourist and mountaineering roads and railway-beds destroyed and a large area of farmland totally submerged. 
					
					 The premier praised servicepersons for reconstructing main bridges and dykes to be stronger than before by introducing a new method of construction true to the intention of Supreme Commander Marshal Kim Jong Un to complete the operations to recover from the flood damage at the earliest possible date. He encouraged the railway workers in their drive to recover from flood damage. He learned about the living conditions of the people in the afflicted areas.
					
					 He held consultative meetings of officials concerned on the spots. 
					
					 The meetings discussed ways of preventing flood damage, the issues of determining a proper order of priority for recovery operations and scientifically designing land improvement under a long-term plan. 
					
					 The premier said that even a tree and a blade of grass of the country is associated with the devoted services rendered by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il to the Korean people. He stressed the need to carry out the recovery operations on the principle of not allowing even a slight damage. 
					
					 It is necessary to ensure quality in all projects for recovery so that they may remain impeccable in the distant future, bearing deep in mind the noble patriotism of Kim Jong Un, he noted. 
					
					 The consultative meetings took practical measures calling on the Cabinet and other relevant units to produce and supply in time necessary materials and equipment for recovery and the counties to tap local reserves to the maximum and enhance the function and role of the field headquarters.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il Meets Iranian Ambassador to DPRK
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Meets Iranian Ambassador to DPRK 
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Il, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, met and had a talk with Morteza Moradian, Iranian ambassador to the DPRK who made a farewell call on him Thursday.

articles.title: CPRK Spokesman Seriously Warns S. Korean Puppet Group of Its Anti-DPRK Vituperations
articles.content:
CPRK Spokesman Seriously Warns S. Korean Puppet Group of Its Anti-DPRK Vituperations
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea gave the following answer to the question raised by KCNA on Thursday as regards a spate of vituperations let loose recently by the south Korean puppet group, taken aback by Supreme Commander Marshal Kim Jong Un's field  inspection of island defence detachments on the foremost front:
					 Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un made a sudden field inspection of island defence detachments stationed in the biggest hotspot in the southernmost part of the southwest front at a grim time when a touch-and-go situation is prevailing owing to the U.S. imperialists and the puppet group of traitors' reckless moves for a war of aggression. This news is creating great sensation in south Korea and the world.
					
					 Watching enemy positions within hailing distance, he issued the following order: "Should the enemy recklessly dare start firing, you should promptly deal deadly counter-blows at him, not confining the clash to a local war, and lead it to a great war for the country's reunification." This is a declaration of sure victory demonstrating the spirit, pluck and bravery of the brilliant commander born of Heaven and a great thunderbolt bringing heavy sledge hammers down on the heads of the sworn enemy.
					
					 His inspection of the island defence detachments was the most transparent crystal of love for soldiers and people linked with the same intention and feelings, love for the younger generation and a striking demonstration of the harmonious whole in which all service personnel and people are single-mindedly united with him.
					
					 The service personnel and the people of the DPRK, immensely moved and excited to hear the news of his inspection of the island defence detachments, are filled with the firm determination to annihilate the sworn enemy and achieve the historic victory in the great war for the country's reunification in hearty response to the combat order issued by the brilliant commander of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists and the puppet warmongers are seized with extreme fear after pushing the situation on the Korean Peninsula to the danger of all-out war through their joint military drills for aggression. 
					
					What should not be overlooked is that the puppet confrontation maniacs, military warmongers and conservatives dared vociferate about "provocation", "creation of tension", "propaganda and agitation" and the like.
					
					 This is no more than a reckless racket of those who are much upset by the sky-high spirit of the great brilliant commander of Mt. Paektu and the strong determination of all the service personnel and people of the DPRK to annihilate the enemy and the last-ditch efforts of those affected by persecution mania.
					
					 The group of traitors finally kicked off the large-scale war exercises for invading the DPRK in league with the U.S. despite the positive efforts of the DPRK and the strong opposition of the public at home and abroad for peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula, bringing the dark clouds of a nuclear disaster to hang over it. Such being a hard fact, the group dared talk about someone's "provocation" and "creation of tension". It is, preposterous, indeed, and an unpardonable mockery of the whole Korean nation and public opinion at home and abroad.
					
					 Such outbursts as "remarks for closing ranks," "ones for demonstration" and "propaganda and agitation" let loose by the puppet group are nothing but base utterances defiling the unbreakable single-minded unity of the DPRK and a high degree of ideological and moral world of its army and people and revealing their ignorance of them.
					
					 The puppet group let loose a spate of malignant invectives which can convince no one. This is aimed to play down even a bit sensation and shock sparked off by the field inspection of the island defence detachments and bring the confusion within it under control. It is, at the same time, no more than a ridiculous artifice to justify its reckless moves for confrontation and war and escape the ever- deepening internal and external isolation. But the puppet group is seriously mistaken if it thinks it can cover up its true colors as hideous confrontation maniac and warmongers, mislead public opinion and get rid of an abyss of ruin through such a dirty farce.
					
					 The service personnel and people of the DPRK are fully ready to launch decisive battles of justice for national reunification in hearty response to the combat order issued by the brilliant commander of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 The ceaseless spate of invectives let loose by the group of traitors would only harden the will of the army and people of the DPRK to wipe out the confrontation maniacs to the last man.
					
					 As solemnly declared internally and externally, the DPRK will neither tolerate the reckless war maneuvers and provocations of the U.S. imperialists and the group of traitors nor miss the golden opportunity.
					
					 The aggressors and provocateurs should clearly understand that the order to wage a war for national reunification has already been issued.

articles.title: Member of British Labour Party Here
articles.content:
Member of British Labour Party Here 
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- Glyn Ford, member of the National Policy Forum of the British Labour Party, and his party arrived here on Thursday.

articles.title: Vietnamese Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Vietnamese Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- A friendship delegation of the Service Department of Diplomatic Corps of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Vietnam led by Director General Nguyen Van Hoa visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung, on Thursday.
					 The members of the delegation looked round historic relics, being briefed on the revolutionary history of the President and his patriotic and revolutionary family members at Mangyongdae.
					
					 At the end of the visit the head of the delegation said:
					
					 I deem it an honor to visit Kim Il Sung's birthplace at Mangyongdae. 
					
					 The President devoted his all to the happiness of the people.
					
					 I am convinced that the Korean people will achieve greater successes in the efforts to accomplish the socialist cause under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea led by the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The delegation also visited the State Exhibition of Gifts, the Tower of the Juche Idea, etc.

articles.title: Cuban Embassy Officials Visit Central Zoo
articles.content:
Cuban Embassy Officials Visit Central Zoo 
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- German Hermin Ferras Alvarez, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK, and his embassy officials visited the Central Zoo here Thursday on the occasion of the month of solidarity with the Cuban people.
					 After being briefed on the fact that the zoo was successfully built as a center which helps people lead a cultural and emotional life and the visitors get knowledge of animals, the guests looked round an aquarium, cages of fierce animals, play pools for animals, places for watching animals' feats and other places.
					
					 At the end of the visit, the ambassador said that President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il worked heart and soul to provide the people with highly civilized living conditions. 
					
					 Noting that he was deeply touched to watch working people and schoolchildren having their pleasant rest, he said that the zoo was a treasure of the people.

articles.title: Participants in International Academic Symposium Visit International Friendship Exhibition House
articles.content:
Participants in International Academic Symposium Visit International Friendship Exhibition House
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- The participants in the international academic symposium of Kim Il Sung University visited the International Friendship Exhibition House on Thursday.
					 They paid tribute to the wax replicas of President Kim Il Sung and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk who performed the undying feats for the times and mankind.
					
					 They went round with deep emotion gifts which the President, leader Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un received from heads of parties, states and governments and distinguished figures of many countries.
					
					 Niu Weilin, head of the delegation of People's University of China, said the visit offered an opportunity to him to feel the boundless reverence of the world people for the President.
					
					 The President made the gifts he received treasures of the country. The gifts will convey long his feats and traits.
					
					 Marceli Burdelski, delegate of Gdansk University of Poland, noted that Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il were the great men recognized by the world, adding:
					
					  Their feats for mankind will shine forever.
					
					  It is the great pride of the Korean people to have the International Friendship Exhibition House associated with the reverence for the great men.
					
					Chen Weipeng, delegate of Qinghua University of China, said Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il were the great men. The world people are boundlessly revering them, he noted, adding the great men are alive in the hearts of all people.

articles.title: Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Gives Film Show, Reception
articles.content:
Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Gives Reception 
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Alexandr Timonin gave reception at the embassy on Thursday on the occasion of the 10th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's historic visit to the Far Eastern Region and the first anniversary of his visit to the Siberian and Far Eastern Regions of the Russian Federation.
					 Present there on invitation were Vice-Premier of the Cabinet Kang Sok Ju, Secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea Kim Yong Il, Minister of Railways Jon Kil Su, Minister of Foreign Trade Ri Ryong Nam, Chairman of the Commission for Joint Venture and Investment Ri Kwang Gun, and officials concerned.
					
					 The participants watched Korean documentary film "Great Leader Comrade Kim Jong Il Pays an Unofficial Visit to Siberian and Far Eastern Regions of Russia".
					
					 Then a reception was given.
					
					 Alexandr Timonin said that Kim Jong Il's visits to the Far Eastern Region and Siberian and Far Eastern Region of the Russian Federation made a contribution to actively promoting the development of the friendly relations between the two countries and boosting cooperation in different fields. 
					
					 Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, is paying deep attention to developing the friendly relations between the two countries, he said. 
					
					 He also said it is important for Russia to have good neighborly relations with the DPRK. 
					
					 Kang Sok Ju said that Kim Jong Il's visits to the Far Eastern region and the Siberian and Far Eastern Regions of the Russian Federation marked a landmark event in boosting the relations between the DPRK and Russia to a new higher stage in conformity with the aspiration and desire of the peoples of the two countries.
					
					 He noted that the DPRK-Russia friendly and cooperative relations are steadily developing in various fields under the deep care of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He expressed belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the DPRK and Russia would grow stronger thanks to the common efforts.
					
					 On the same day, the Russian consulate general in Chongjin also gave a reception.

articles.title: Reception Given by ASEAN Committee Here
articles.content:
Reception Given by ASEAN Committee Here
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- The ASEAN Committee here hosted a reception at the Cambodian embassy on Thursday to mark the 45th anniversary of ASEAN.
					 Present there on invitation were Pak Ui Chun, minister of Foreign Affairs, Pak Kun Gwang, vice department director of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Jin Bom, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, officials concerned and diplomatic envoys of various countries and representatives of international organizations here.
					
					 Among those present there were Cambodian Ambassador to the DPRK Chhorn Hay who is chairman of the ASEAN Committee here, Vietnamese Ambassador Le Quang Ba, Lao Ambassador Kiettisak Keobanhdith, Indonesian Ambassador Nasri Gustaman, Charge d'Affaires ad interim of the Malaysian embassy Mohamad Hasril Abdul Hamid, and staff members of foreign embassies here.

articles.title: National Scientific and Technological Forum Held
articles.content:
Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- A national scientific and technological forum in the field of nature conservation took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Thursday to mark the 10th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's work "Let's Build the Country into a Tapestry-like Land in the Era of Workers' Party through Dynamic Afforestation and Water Conservation".
					 Present there were scientists, technicians and teachers in the field of nature conservation.
					
					 Jong Yong Nam, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Nature Conservation Union of Korea, made an inaugural speech.
					
					 He said the work published on March 6, 2002 serves as important guidelines for turning the country into a socialist fairyland for happy people and implementing the far-reaching plan of the Workers' Party of Korea for a thriving nation.
					
					 Kim Jong Il's idea of land management and exploits are being creditably carried forward by the dear respected Kim Jong Un, he noted, referring to the scientific research achievements made in the field of nature conservation.
					
					 The forum heard more than 50 new and valuable papers presented by officials, scientists, technicians and experts in the fields of forestry, plant, land and water conservation. 
					
					 Among them were papers on researches to settle the seed problem of good species of trees in major forests and introduce good species of oil-bearing chestnut and research on a method of making analysis of real-time simulation flood control during dam construction.
					
					 Drawing attention of the participants were research on protecting diversity of plants in the area of Mt. Paektu, a method of deciding flood water level, etc.

articles.title: Rason Int'l Trade Fair Held
articles.content:
Rason Int'l Trade Fair Held
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- The 2nd Rason International Trade Fair was held in Rason City. 
					 Exhibited in the fair were electrical and electronic products, vehicles, light industrial goods and medical products presented by more than 110 units of various countries and regions including the DPRK, China, Russia, Sweden, the Czech Republic and Taipei of China. 
					
					 During the fair there were trading and scientific and technological exchanges among trading companies and businessmen of foreign countries and regions and a discussion on the investment in the Rason Economic Trade Zone. 
					
					 A closing ceremony took place on Thursday.
					
					 It was attended by Jo Jong Ho, chairman of the Rason City People's Committee who is the chairman of the organizing committee of the international trade fair, officials concerned and local and foreign exhibitors. 
					
					 Diplomas were awarded to the exhibitors which presented excellent goods.

articles.title: DPRK Documentary Film Shown
articles.content:
DPRK Documentary Film Shown
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- A DPRK documentary film "President Kim Il Sung and General Kim Jong Il Were Always Together on the Road of Great Songun Leadership" was shown at the People's Palace of Culture on Thursday on the occasion of the 52nd anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 The film shows the feats Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il performed by developing the Korean revolutionary armed forces into the most elite powerful army of Mt. Paektu with their outstanding Songun revolutionary idea and leadership and providing a firm military guarantee for defending the country and ensuring eternal prosperity of the nation.
					
					 It has scenes dealing with the facts that the President established the leadership system of Kim Jong Il throughout the army and made sure that the revolutionary cause of Juche was carried forward with arms.
					
					 The film deals with the feats Kim Jong Il performed by developing the Korean People's Army into an army of the leader and the party and a core unit of the Songun revolution since he started his Songun revolutionary leadership with his field guidance to Seoul Ryu Kyong Su 105 Guards Tank Division of the KPA.
					
					 The film stresses that thanks to the KPA trained under the loving care of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, the dignity and spirit of the country and the nation have been demonstrated before the whole world and there arrived a heyday of grandeur and prosperity.
					
					 The film was watched by Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim and other senior officials of the party and state and officials of the Cabinet, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions.

articles.title: Performance Given by Members of Art Group of Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace
articles.content:
Performance Given by Members of Art Group of Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace
						
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- A performance was given by members of the art group of the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace on Thursday to mark the 52nd anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 It began with prelude "May Generalissimo's Star Shine Forever". Put on the stage were female chorus "Light of Jeep" and other colorful numbers.
					
					 The performers impressively represented the boundless reverence for Kim Jong Il who devoted all his life to the prosperity of the country and the happiness of posterity till the last moments of his life since he started the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					 Also staged were numbers dealing with the joy of happy children under the care of the dear respected Kim Jong Un and reflecting the will of the children to fight in defence of the country under his leadership just as the juvenile guerrillas did during the war when the time to wage a decisive battle comes.

articles.title: Day of Pakistan Marked in DPRK
articles.content:
Day of Pakistan Marked in DPRK
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- A friendship meeting with staff members of the Pakistani embassy here was held at the DPRK-Pakistan Friendship June 9 Ryongbuk Secondary School on Thursday on the 65th independence day of Pakistan.
					 Present there on invitation were the charge d' affaires ad interim and staff members of the Pakistani embassy.
					
					 Members of the DPRK-Pakistan Friendship Association and teachers and students of the school were present there.
					
					 The participants looked round educational facilities of the school after being briefed on its history.
					
					 They talked to one another about the need to develop the bilateral friendly relations and enjoyed an art performance given by students.

articles.title: World Breastfeeding Week Observed
articles.content:
World Breastfeeding Week Observed
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- An event took place in Wonsan, Kangwon Province, on Thursday on the occasion of the World Breastfeeding Week. 
					 Present there were officials of the Ministry of Public Health, Pyongyang Maternity Hospital and maternity hospitals in all provinces, officials of the women's union, media persons, the representative of the UNICEF and staff members of missions of other international organizations here.
					
					 An inaugural speech was followed by congratulatory speeches and presentation of experience. 
					
					 Speakers referred to the achievements and experience gained in breastfeeding. 
					
					 They underscored the need to successfully raise babies by enhancing public attention to the breastfeeding, children's growth and health promotion. 
					
					 The participants went round the maternity hospital in Kangwon Province and others on the same day.

articles.title: More Rainfall Forecast in Late August in DPRK
articles.content:
More Rainfall Forecast in Late August in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- It is likely that most areas of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea will experience rainfall on Aug. 25, affected by a low pressure trough passing the central part of Korea.
					 Rain and downpour will hit most areas of the country on Aug. 27-28, affected by a low pressure trough passing the northern part of the country and typhoon-15 moving northward from the south of the West Sea of Korea.
					
					 In the period, the highest temperature in the daytime in Pyongyang is expected to be 29 degrees Celsius, one degree Celsius higher than the average.
					
					 The lowest temperature will be the same as the average year or a little higher.

articles.title: Typhoon-15 to Hit DPRK
articles.content:
Typhoon-15 to Hit DPRK
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- Typhoon-15 is now moving northwestward at a velocity of 12 kilometers per hour as of 09:00 Thursday.
					 With its central pressure measuring 955 hPa, it is staying at 19 degrees 42 minutes north latitude and 135 degrees 53 minutes east longitude.
					
					 The typhoon's maximum wind speed is 38m/s, with radiuses of 160 km and 480 km at wind speeds of 25 m/s and 15 m/s.
					
					 It is expected to come to the sea off Shanghai, China on around Aug. 27 and move northward along the west coastal area of Korea before reaching the Chinese northeastern region on the evening of Aug. 28.
					
					 It is known that the typhoon's central pressure is very low and its wind strong.
					
					 The typhoon-15 will trigger strong wind and heavy rains in overall areas of Korea on Aug. 27-28.

articles.title: DPRK Women's Football Team Snubs Its Argentine Rival 9:0
articles.content:
DPRK Women's Football Team Snubs Its Argentine Rival 9:0
						
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- The DPRK women's football team played a match with its Argentine rival on Thursday at 2012 U-20 Women's World Cup.
					 The DPRK team trounced its Argentine rival 9:0.
					
					 It will play the last league match with its Canadian rival on Aug. 27.

articles.title: Pyongyang Ready to Welcome Delegates to Celebrations of Youth Day
articles.content:
Pyongyang Ready to Welcome Delegates to Celebrations of Youth Day
						
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang is wrapped in a festive atmosphere in the run-up to Youth Day to be marked with splendor amid great attention and blessings of the whole party and all people and service personnel. 
					 All preparations have been made to welcome delegates of youth from across the country to celebrations of Youth Day, an event to be specially recorded in the history of the Workers' Party of Korea and the country.
					
					 Officials and working people of the relevant fields have stepped up the preparations, true to the noble intention of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un who provided the celebrations unprecedented in history, reposing deep trust in the young people that their dynamic advance would help bring earlier the morrow of a thriving nation.
					
					 The units in charge of transportation of delegates are fully ready for operation after winding up the maintenance of buses.
					
					 Theaters in the capital city including the Ponghwa Art Theater and Pyongyang Circus are busy with preparations for performances. 
					
					 Artistes of national art organizations are devoting their wisdom and energies to presenting numbers dealing with the immortal exploits performed by the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu in the Korean youth movement and labor drives of members of the young vanguard who have always remained true to the call of the party. 
					
					The Rungna People's Pleasure Ground and the Kaeson Youth Park Funfair associated with the warm love of leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un for the people are waiting for the day to greet youth delegates who would have rest in fantastic places.
					
					 Catering facilities in the capital city including Okryu and Chongryu restaurants are ready to serve the delegates a variety of food meeting their taste including famous noodle prepared with meat. 
					
					 Wherever they will go, the delegates will keenly feel the profound trust and love of the party and the people's expectation and renew their resolution to devote themselves to the accomplishment of the revolutionary cause of Juche true to Kim Jong Un's Songun leadership.

articles.title: DPRK People Ready for Sacred War
articles.content:
DPRK People Ready for Sacred War
						
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, during his recent inspection tour of island defence detachments stationed in the biggest hotspot in the southernmost part of the southwest front, ordered the servicepersons to deal at once deadly counter-blows at the enemy if even a single shell is dropped on the waters or in the territory of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and lead the battle to a sacred war for national reunification.  
					 In response to the order, not only servicepersons but all other people of the DPRK are now in combat readiness for a possible war.
					
					 Kim Il Sin, a workshop head of the Chollima Steel Complex, told KCNA:
					
					 "It is high time that we made a clean sweep of the U.S. forces and the rat-like Lee Myung Bak group of south Korea, who are running amuck to attack the DPRK, like a puppy knowing no fear of tiger. 
					
					 The DPRK is guided by the illustrious commander, Marshal Kim Jong Un, with its servicepersons and civilians closely united around him.
					
					 If the enemies dare preempt reckless firing, all the servicepersons and civilians will deal at once deadly counter-blows at them and reunify the country."
					
					 Kim Chun Son, chief engineer of the Ryongho Co-op Farm in Rangnang District in Pyongyang, said:
					
					 "We, agricultural workers, are ready to fulfill the supreme commander's order together with the servicepersons.
					
					 Anyone who provokes the DPRK will meet an annihilating counterattack."

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised as Brilliant Songun Commander
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised as Brilliant Songun Commander 
						
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- World progressives highly praise leader Kim Jong Il as a great brilliant Songun commander who demonstrated the dignity and might of the Korean nation with his unique Songun politics. 
					 Alberto Anaya Gutierrez, coordinator of the National Coordinating Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico, said that Kim Jong Il firmly defended Korean-style socialism by pursuing Songun politics. 
					
					 The Songun politics serves as a banner of struggle for those countries desirous of independence against imperialism, he added. 
					
					 Thongbanh Seng A Phone, head of the delegation of the Ministry of Public Security of Laos, said that Kim Jong Il provided the DPRK with strong military power, adding that the country is shining as an invincible bulwark of socialism thanks to its strong army. 
					
					 The countries aspiring after independence should learn from the Songun politics and the exploits performed by Kim Jong Il for strengthening the military muscle will last forever, he stressed. 
					
					 Gyula Thurmer, head of a delegation of the Hungarian Communist Workers' Party, said that Kim Jong Il put the dignity of the Korean nation on the highest level and the DPRK could create the history of victory and glory under his leadership.
					
					 Abdullatif Oumran, general director of the Syrian Paper Al Baath, said that the Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il gives confidence and courage to the people of the countries aspiring after independence, peace and socialism. 
					
					 Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee, said that Kim Jong Il was a peerless statesman and great defender of the cause of socialism, adding the progressive people highly praise him as a great brilliant Songun commander.

articles.title: Servicepersons Play Key Role in Building Edifices
articles.content:
Servicepersons Play Key Role in Building Edifices
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- Servicepersons of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea play a key role in speeding up the building of a thriving socialist nation.
					 With readiness to take upon themselves both the defence of the country and socialist construction, they have built many edifices in recent years, creating a high speed in construction.
					
					 Their energetic efforts led to the construction of the Huichon Power Station, a representative edifice in the Songun (military-first) era, and the greenhouse under the Bioengineering Branch of the State Academy of Sciences.
					
					 They splendidly built the Exhibition of Arms and Equipment of the Korean People's Army, which showcases the undying feats President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il performed in leading the Songun revolution as well as the development of self-reliant defense industry.
					
					 They also took part in the construction of modern high-rise apartment buildings, skyscrapers, the People's Theatre and stylish restaurants in Changjon Street and dolphin aquarium, wading pool and funfair on scenic Rungna Island in Pyongyang in a short span of time.
					
					 They are now giving the final touch to the projects of the Ryugyong Health Complex, People's Open-Air Ice Rink, Sporting Centre in Thongil Street, Breast Cancer Institute of the Pyongyang Maternity Hospital and Pyongyang Folk Park. 
					
					 Such edifices can be built only by the DPRK servicepersons, who take as their faith Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un's noble outlook on the people and the future.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Redeem Its Past Crimes Committed against Korea
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Redeem Its Past Crimes Committed against Korea 
						
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- Japan should fulfill its historical, legal and moral obligation by redressing its monstrous crime-woven past as early as possible. Only by doing so, can it get trust from the international community.
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 The article is carried in connection with the Japanese imperialists' fabrication of the "Korea-Japan Annexation Treaty" by military threat and blackmail in August of 1910. 
					
					 The article cites facts to prove that it was an illegal false document fabricated by them by force of arms in a bid to annex Korea, to all intents and purposes.
					
					 This being a hard fact, the Japanese reactionaries are trying hard to paint "the treaty" as a legal one, asserting that it was the "choice of the Koreans" and "Japan went through all procedures."
					
					 This is an intolerable insult and mockery of the Korean people who had been forced to live as colonial slaves for decades due to the Japanese imperialists' brigandish fabrication of the "treaty". 
					
					 Many years have passed since the Japanese imperialists suffered a defeat but Japan is persistently pursuing an anachronistic hostile policy towards the DPRK, far from honestly making apology and reparation for its past crimes.
					
					 This behavior is little short of adding to the crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists against the Korean people in the past.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will never forget their crimes no matter how much water may flow under the bridge but force Japan, the sworn enemy of the Korean people, to redeem its past crimes to the last.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Merciless Punishment to Provocateurs
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Merciless Punishment to Provocateurs 
						
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists and the south Korean Lee Myung Bak group of traitors kicked off the worst military provocation aimed at invading the DPRK. It is, therefore, quite natural for the army and people of the DPRK to strongly react to it. Rodong Sinmun Thursday says this in a bylined article.
					 Due to the reckless confrontation and war moves of the U.S. and the south Korean regime, tension has been extremely escalated on the Korean Peninsula, pushing the situation to a grave phase, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 As long as the anti-DPRK confrontation policy is pursued and war drills targeted against it never cease in south Korea, the Korean nation can neither see a peaceful environment on the Korean Peninsula nor escape the danger of a nuclear war.
					
					 The developments go to prove that it is the only way of achieving lasting peace on the peninsula to wage a sacred war of justice to put an end to the politically-motivated military provocations of the U.S. and the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors and attain national reunification.
					
					 The DPRK has so far made every possible effort to improve the inter-Korean relations and achieve peace and reunification of the country.
					
					 There is, however, a limit to its patience.
					
					 Its service personnel and people are now all out to wipe out the Lee group keen to bring dark clouds of a nuclear war to hang over Korea in collusion with the U.S.
					
					 They will mercilessly punish the invaders and provocateurs in hearty response to the order given by the great brilliant commander of Mt. Paektu as their hearts are burning with the spirit of devotedly protecting the leader and the country and conviction of sure victory, concludes the article.

articles.title: Seminar on Kim Jong Un's Work Held in Mexico
articles.content:
Seminar on Kim Jong Un's Work Held in Mexico
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- A seminar on the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Hold Great Comrade Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as General Secretary of Our Party Forever and Successfully Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche" was held in Mexico on August 13.
					 Displayed in the venue of the seminar were works of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un and photos and books on the achievements made by the Korean people in building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 Ramon Jimenez Lopez, president of the Mexican National Coordinating Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea who is chairman of the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, said holding the seminar on the work of Kim Jong Un was of great significance, adding:
					
					 Kim Jong Un made public the important work on April 6 that calls for successfully accomplishing the revolutionary causes of Juche and Songun, holding Kim Jong Il in high esteem as eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 In the work he referred to the exploits of Kim Jong Il, who developed the WPK into the party of Kim Il Sung with his outstanding ideas and theories and extraordinary leadership.
					
					 He in his work declared the WPK as the glorious party of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism as its guiding idea. 
					
					 Speakers at the seminar praised the work of Kim Jong Un as an important work that clearly indicated the road for the era of independence and Songun Korea, expressing their will to intensify the activities for studying and disseminating Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- Special write-ups interwoven with articles were posted on Internet homepages of different countries on Aug. 15, the 67th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 The Polish Internet homepage "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea" posted photos of President Kim Il Sung's revolutionary activities including photos of him standing together with anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					
					 The homepage carried articles speaking highly of the feats the President performed by waging the hard-fought anti-Japanese armed struggle to liberate the country.
					
					 The Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea posted on its Internet homepage an article titled "Kim Il Sung, liberator of Korea" with his photo, recalling that he liberated Korea from the yoke of the Japanese imperialists and saved the Koreans from the fate of colonial slaves.
					
					 The MS Travel Agency of Germany in its Internet homepage noted he embarked on the road of revolution in his early years and formed the Down-with-Imperialism Union, laying down the line of the anti-Japanese armed struggle. 
					
					 It continued:
					
					 Kim Il Sung laid a solid foundation for the great unity of the whole nation.
					
					 He created a lot of combat methods, strategies and tactics during the period of the anti-Japanese armed struggle. The Korean people are looking up to him as the sun of the nation and the liberator of Korea.
					
					 He is now alive in the hearts of the Korean people.

articles.title: Day of Korea's Liberation Observed by Papers of India, Uruguay
articles.content:
Day of Korea's Liberation Observed by Papers of India, Uruguay 
						
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- Papers of India and Uruguay carried special write-ups with photos of President Kim Il Sung on the occasion of the 67th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 The Indian newspaper New Delhi Times on Aug. 14 said the anti-Japanese armed struggle waged by Kim Il Sung was the legendary guerrilla struggle unprecedented in human history.
					
					 He waged a 15-year-long hard-fought guerrilla war against the Japanese imperialists under the difficult situation with neither state backing nor help from regular forces.
					
					 The guerrilla struggle waged by him produced many legends widely known to the world at that time.
					
					 The great personality of Kim Il Sung as a legendary guerrilla will always go down in history.
					
					 The August 13th issue of the Indian newspaper Indian and World Event carried an article praising the exploits performed by him for Korea's liberation.
					
					 The Uruguayan newspaper La Juventud on Aug. 14 noted that he founded the Korean People's Revolutionary Army and led to victory the anti-Japanese armed struggle with his original strategies and tactics.
					
					 The Korean people courageously turned out in the sacred war against the Japanese imperialists, looking up to him as the sun of the nation and the liberator of Korea. At last they achieved the historic cause of the nation's liberation and paved a wide avenue for building an independent and sovereign state, responsible for their own destiny, the paper said.
					
					 The exploits performed by Kim Il Sung for Korea's liberation will remain shining through centuries, concluded the paper.

articles.title: Chinese Paper Hopes for Ever-lasting Sino-DPRK Friendship
articles.content:
Chinese Paper Hopes for Ever-lasting Sino-DPRK Friendship
						
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- The August 17th issue of Liaoning Josonmunbo in China carried an article titled "May Sino-DPRK Friendship last forever".
					 The paper said that war veterans of the Chinese People's Volunteers (CPV) visited the DPRK and spent happy days unforgettable in their lifetime on the occasion of the 59th anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War, referring to the their visit to the Friendship Tower and the cemeteries of fallen fighters of the CPV.
					
					 The war veterans were deeply moved by the fact that the DPRK government and its people have always taken good care of the cemeteries of the fallen fighters of the CPV for decades. This was an expression of sincere love shown by the Korean people for the Chinese people and the CPV, the paper said, and went on:
					
					 During their visit to the DPRK the veterans were pleased to witness the brilliant achievements made by the Korean people under the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung and General Kim Jong Il and the appearance of the DPRK developing as the days go by.
					
					 They were greatly inspired by all Korean people making a dynamic advance for building a thriving socialist nation, single-mindedly united around their supreme leader Kim Jong Un in his era, in particular.
					
					 The paper hoped for ever-lasting Sino-DPRK friendship.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Carried by Iranian Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Carried by Iranian Paper
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- A gist of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Effect Kim Jong Il's Patriotism and Step Up the Building of a Prosperous Country" was carried by the Iranian paper Iran News on Aug. 15.
					 The work, made public on July 26, 2012, clarifies the essence of leader Kim Jong Il's patriotism and his life characterized by his ardent love for the country and its people.
					
					 The work also clarifies important issues in embodying Kim Jong Il's patriotism.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Sends Condolences to Ethiopian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Sends Condolences to Ethiopian President
						
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of condolence to Ethiopian President Girma Wolde-Giorgis over Ethiopian Prime Minister Meles Zenawi's sudden death of illness.
					 Kim in the message expressed profound sorrow and sincere condolences to Girma Wolde-Giorgis and, through him, to the bereaved family of the deceased, the government and people of Ethiopia.

articles.title: Monument Erected in Russia in Commemoration of Kim Jong Il's Visit to Siberian, Far Eastern Regions of Russia
articles.content:
Monument Erected in Russia in Commemoration of Kim Jong Il's Visit to Siberian, Far Eastern Regions of Russia
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- On the occasion of the first anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's visit to Siberian and Far Eastern Regions of Russia a monument was erected in Amur Region of Russia.
					 Russian people erected the monument by cutting natural granite to be 108 cm high and 60 cm wide.
					
					 Carved on the monument was Kim Jong Il's autograph "Inexhaustible is the strength of the Russian people who harnessed the nature of Bureya. August 21, 2011 Kim Jong Il."
					
					 Seen below it is the Russian explanation "Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, on Aug. 21, 2011 visited Bureya Hydro-electric Plant and left his autograph 'Inexhaustible is the strength of the Russian people who harnessed the nature of Bureya. August 21, 2011 Kim Jong Il."
					
					 An unveiling ceremony was held at the Bureya Hydro-electric Plant in Amur Region on Tuesday.
					
					 Present there were figures of different circles and people of Amur Region. DPRK delegations visiting the region and staff members of the DPRK mission in Khabarovsk were present on invitation.
					
					 There were speeches.
					
					 The vice-minister of Culture of the Amur Regional Government said Kim Jong Il's visit to the region was of weighty significance in the development of the friendly and cooperative ties between the DPRK and Amur Region. 
					
					 The feats he performed for developing the Russia-DPRK ties of friendship and cooperation will always be remembered by the Russian people, he added.
					
					 Then the monument was unveiled.
					
					 The participants laid floral baskets and bouquets before it.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked by Koreans in Russia
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked by Koreans in Russia
						
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- The Confederation of Koreans in Far East and Siberia held events in Khabarovsk City of the Russian Federation on August 17 and 18 on the occasion of the 67th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 Present there were officials of the confederation and the United Confederation of Koreans in Khabarovsk Territory and compatriots.
					
					 Present there on invitation were consuls of the DPRK mission in Khabarovsk, deputy presidential envoy to the Far East Region of Russia, vice-minister of Culture of the Khabarovsk Territory Government and department director of the Khabarovsk City Administration.
					
					 Paek Ku Son, chairman of the Confederation of Koreans in Far East and Siberia, said the undying feats Generalissimo Kim Il Sung performed in achieving the historic cause of Korea's liberation would shine forever.
					
					 He noted that the prestige of the DPRK is rising in the world day by day and compatriots are living with the high pride of being members of the Korean nation.
					
					 Choe Song Jon, chairman of the United Confederation of Koreans in Khabarovsk Territory, said: The DPRK is energetically pushing forward the building of a thriving socialist nation despite the vicious moves of the U.S. and the south Korean puppet group of traitors, adding that this greatly encourages overseas Koreans.
					
					 The cause of building a thriving nation and national reunification is sure to be achieved thanks to the wise leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, he said, reiterating the will to intensify the movement of reunification.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days Marked in Far East of Russia
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days Marked in Far East of Russia
						
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- Colorful events took place in the Far Eastern region of Russia between Aug. 19 and 21 on the occasions of the 10th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's visit to the Far Eastern region of Russia, the 1st anniversary of his visit to the Siberian and Far Eastern regions of Russia, 52nd anniversary of his start of the Songun revolutionary leadership, 67th anniversary of Korea's liberation and 64th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 On display in the venues of the events were photos showing Kim Jong Il's historic visit to the Siberian and Far Eastern regions of Russia and photos showing the glorious revolutionary careers and immortal feats of the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Also on display there were works of the peerlessly great persons, books introducing the advantages of Korean-style socialism centered on the popular masses and art works associated with the wisdom and skills of the Korean people.
					
					 Present there were personages of various circles of the Amur Regional Government and Nakhodka City of the Maritime Territory of Russia, masses, DPRK delegations visiting Amur Region and staff members of the DPRK missions in Nakhodka and Khabarovsk Cities.
					
					 The participants laid floral baskets and bouquets before portraits of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 An art performance was given by pupils of DPRK-Russia friendship Moranbong Secondary School No. 1 at an opening ceremony of the DPRK-Russia friendship cultural festival in Blagobeshensk City of Amur Region.
					
					 An event took place with splendor in Nakhodka City to mark the Day of Korean Culture.
					
					 An opening ceremony of the DPRK book, photo and handicraft exhibition was held at the folk museum of Amur Region while the DPRK mission in Khabarovsk hosted a reception.
					
					 Goreboi, minister for foreign economic ties, tourism and business of the Amur Regional Government, handed to the head of the DPRK delegation on a visit to Amur Region a letter presented to the dear respected Kim Jong Un by the governor of the region on the occasion of the 1st anniversary of Kim Jong Il's visit to the Siberian and Far Eastern regions of the Russian Federation.

articles.title: U.S. Interference in Internal Affairs of Nigeria under Signboard of "Assistance" under Fire
articles.content:
U.S. Interference in Internal Affairs of Nigeria under Signboard of "Assistance" under Fire 
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- The United States is becoming more undisguised in its moves to interfere in the internal affairs of Nigeria under the signboard of "assistance".
					 During her tour of African countries Hillary, U.S. secretary of State, visited Nigeria on August 9 where she became vociferous, taking issue with "Boko Haram," an Islamic group in the country. She called for putting an end to the group, asserting that all issues such as security, socio-economic development and eradication of poverty are linked with the group and the police, army and government should pool their efforts to rout it. She added if Nigeria makes efforts to eliminate the group, the U.S. will become a strong "patron" of it. Then the U.S. designated Boko Haram as an international terrorist organization.
					
					 Boko Haram is an extreme Islamic group calling for enforcing the Islamic law in the whole areas of Nigeria while inciting hostility toward the Christians which account for 40 percent of its population.
					
					 The Nigerian government has made ceaseless efforts to root out antagonism among tribes, a leftover of the colonial rule of the imperialists, achieve concord and protect the security of the state and its people's life and property from the crimes of extremist elements of the group.
					
					 The group is reported to have weakened due to the positive military actions of the government since 2009.
					
					 It is the stand of the present government that it can surely defuse the threat posed by the Boko Haram by itself.  
					
					 Nevertheless, the U.S. is working hard to internationalize the Boko Haram issue, an internal affair of Nigeria. This is another clear proof of the U.S. arrogant habit of meddling in other's affairs.
					
					 Nigerian President Goodluck Ebele Jonathan said the U.S. measure only helps elevate the group's status as extremists and embolden them.
					
					 The Nigerian ambassador to the U.S. noted that by putting the group on the list of international terrorist organizations the U.S. may attempt to use drone strikes at Nigeria under the pretext of striking Boko Haram's bases and members. He said "We know from the experience of Afghanistan and Pakistan, such drones could lead to destruction of villages and people who are not directly involved in the activities of Boko Haram." 
					
					 After all, the U.S. commitment to give "support" to Nigeria is one that the U.S. will not hesitate to commit indiscriminate air raids on Nigeria, a sovereign state under the signboard of "anti-terrorist war".
					
					 Analysts are concerned that Nigeria, a major oil producer of the world which the U.S. has long eyed, may fall victim to the "anti-terror war", making the situation in Africa more complicated.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con Giancarlo Elia Valori
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Chairman of Italian General Investment Group
						
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with Giancarlo Elia Valori, chairman of the Italian General Investment Group, who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim visita distritos afectados por inundaciones
articles.content:
DPRK People Ready for Sacred War
						
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, during his recent inspection tour of island defence detachments stationed in the biggest hotspot in the southernmost part of the southwest front, ordered the servicepersons to deal at once deadly counter-blows at the enemy if even a single shell is dropped on the waters or in the territory of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and lead the battle to a sacred war for national reunification.  
					 In response to the order, not only servicepersons but all other people of the DPRK are now in combat readiness for a possible war.
					
					 Kim Il Sin, a workshop head of the Chollima Steel Complex, told KCNA:
					
					 "It is high time that we made a clean sweep of the U.S. forces and the rat-like Lee Myung Bak group of south Korea, who are running amuck to attack the DPRK, like a puppy knowing no fear of tiger. 
					
					 The DPRK is guided by the illustrious commander, Marshal Kim Jong Un, with its servicepersons and civilians closely united around him.
					
					 If the enemies dare preempt reckless firing, all the servicepersons and civilians will deal at once deadly counter-blows at them and reunify the country."
					
					 Kim Chun Son, chief engineer of the Ryongho Co-op Farm in Rangnang District in Pyongyang, said:
					
					 "We, agricultural workers, are ready to fulfill the supreme commander's order together with the servicepersons.
					
					 Anyone who provokes the DPRK will meet an annihilating counterattack."

articles.title: Provocadores deben tener presente de la orden del Comandante Supremo
articles.content:
Day of Pakistan Marked in DPRK
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- A friendship meeting with staff members of the Pakistani embassy here was held at the DPRK-Pakistan Friendship June 9 Ryongbuk Secondary School on Thursday on the 65th independence day of Pakistan.
					 Present there on invitation were the charge d' affaires ad interim and staff members of the Pakistani embassy.
					
					 Members of the DPRK-Pakistan Friendship Association and teachers and students of the school were present there.
					
					 The participants looked round educational facilities of the school after being briefed on its history.
					
					 They talked to one another about the need to develop the bilateral friendly relations and enjoyed an art performance given by students.

articles.title: Se ofrece recepcion en embajada camboyana por 45o aniversario de ASEAN
articles.content:
More Rainfall Forecast in Late August in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, August 23 (KCNA) -- It is likely that most areas of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea will experience rainfall on Aug. 25, affected by a low pressure trough passing the central part of Korea.
					 Rain and downpour will hit most areas of the country on Aug. 27-28, affected by a low pressure trough passing the northern part of the country and typhoon-15 moving northward from the south of the West Sea of Korea.
					
					 In the period, the highest temperature in the daytime in Pyongyang is expected to be 29 degrees Celsius, one degree Celsius higher than the average.
					
					 The lowest temperature will be the same as the average year or a little higher.
